results.title: M. Butterfly [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Geffen Pictures, Gabriella Martinelli and David Cronenberg
results.brief_description: Inspired by a true story and based on David Henry Hwang’s award-winning stage play, this film version by David Cronenberg (Naked lunch, Dead ringers) does not quite live up to expectations even though Hwang has written the screenplay. Set in Beijing, in 1964, the story revolves around married French diplomat Rene Gallimard and his obsessive love affair with Beijing Opera star Song Liling who first entranced Gallimard with her performance as Madama Butterfly. As Gallimard becomes more deeply involved with the secretive and allusive Song Liling, life begins to take an unexpected turn - one that involves intrigue, espionage, and betrayal. Starring Jeremy Irons, John Lone, Barbara Sukowa, Annabel Leventon, Shizuko Hoshi, Ian Richardson.

results.title: M*A*S*H* = Mash (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Aspen Productions, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Ingo Preminger, Leon Ericksen and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Hailed as one of the best comedies ever made! Army surgeons during the Korean War develop a lunatic lifestyle in order to cope with the everyday horrors encountered in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. The film mixes slapstick with tragedy and pokes merciless fun at military pomposity, empty religion and incompetence. It sticks its tongue out at hypocrisy - the same attitudes which have mad the television series so successful. Based on a novel by Richard Hooker, the film stars Donald Sutherland, Elliott Gould and Tom Skerritt.

results.title: M Comme Mathieu = M as in Mathieu
results.brief_description:
Mathieu is just out of a convalescing home and resumes life at home with wife Jeanne. His mental health is still unstable and he cannot control his obsession for Muriel, an imaginary woman who looks just like Jeanne.

Credits: Producer, Bob Zagury ; director, Jean-Francois Adam ; writer, Jean-Francois Adam ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Sami Frey, Brigitte Fossey, Roland Dubillard, Bulle Ogier, Laurent Mirouze.

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Lyn McLain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Lyn McLain is the founder and director of the District of Columbia Youth Symphony Orchestra, one of the most extraordinary musical groups in the United States. It is made up of children, aged from eight to seventeen years, from all walks of life, who voluntarily give up their Saturdays to study music.

results.title: Luz
results.brief_description: 128…129…129…a walk through a wondrous neighbourhood that only a child could imagine. A little girl plays in the street while her mother calls her home, wherever we find it.

results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.
